SINDyPDEÂ¶

Derived module from sindybase.py for SINDy of PDE

class pySINDy.sindypde.SINDyPDE(name='SINDy model')

Bases: pySINDy.sindybase.SINDyBase

Data-driven discovery of partial differential equations reference: http://advances.sciencemag.org/content/3/4/e1602614/tab-pdf

compute_spatial_derivatives(data, dx, order, acc)

Compute the spatial derivatives presented in descriptions with proposed method :param data: a dict of arrays, value of state variables :param dx: float or a list of floats, for spatial grid spacing :param order: maximum order of derivatives applied on spatial dimensions :param acc: accuracy of the derivatives :return: a dict of arrays of spatial derivatives

static dict_to_2darray(data_dict)

This function flattens all the arrays in a dict and stack them together :param data_dict: a dict of arrays :return: a 2D numpy array and a list of descriptions

fit(data, dt, dx, poly_degree=2, space_deriv_order=2, cut_off=0.001, deriv_acc=2, sample_rate=1.0)
Parameters:
  • data – a numpy array or a dict of arrays, dynamics data to be processed
  • dt – float, for temporal grid spacing
  • dx – float or list of floats, for spatial grid spacing
  • poly_degree – degree of polynomials to be included in theta matrix (all derivatives remain degree 1)
  • space_deriv_order – maximum order of derivatives applied on spatial dimensions
  • cut_off – the threshold cutoff value for sparsity
  • deriv_acc – (positive) integer, derivative accuracy
  • sample_rate – float, proportion of the data to use
Returns:

a SINDyPDE model
static orders_to_op(order, dx, acc)
Parameters:
  • order – orders of the derivative
  • dx – a float or a list of floats, grid spacings
  • acc – a positive integer, accuracy of the derivatives
Returns:
static product_expansion(u, v, u_desp, v_desp, included=True)
Parameters:
  • u – a 2D numpy array of features stored in each column
  • v – another 2D numpy array of features stored in each column
  • u_desp – a list of descriptions for each columns of u
  • v_desp – a list of descriptions for each columns of v
  • included – a boolean value, indicates whether to include original columns or not
Returns:

a 2D numpy array of product features and corresponding descriptions
static sampling_idxs(shape, space_sample_rate, time_sample_rate, acc_x=2, acc_t=2, major='row')
Parameters:
  • shape – numpy array shape information
  • space_sample_rate – proportion of sampling for spatial dimensions
  • time_sample_rate – proportion of sampling for time dimension
  • width_x – specify the boundary for spatial sampling
  • width_t – specify the boundary for temporal sampling
  • major – either ‘row’ (row major) or ‘col’ (column major)
Returns:

a list of indices of sampling points
